about.summary: The `scorecard` package makes the development of credit risk scorecard easier and efficient by providing functions for some common tasks, such as data partition, variable selection, woe binning, scorecard scaling, performance evaluation and report generation. These functions can also used in the development of machine learning models. The references including: 1. Refaat, M. (2011, ISBN: 9781447511199). Credit Risk Scorecard: Development and Implementation Using SAS. 2. Siddiqi, N. (2006, ISBN: 9780471754510). Credit risk scorecards. Developing and Implementing Intelligent Credit Scoring.

The `scorecard` package makes the development of credit risk scorecard easier and efficient by providing functions for some common tasks, such as data partition, variable selection, woe binning, scorecard scaling, performance evaluation and report generation. These functions can also used in the development of machine learning models. The references including: 1. Refaat, M. (2011, ISBN: 9781447511199). Credit Risk Scorecard: Development and Implementation Using SAS. 2. Siddiqi, N. (2006, ISBN: 9780471754510). Credit risk scorecards. Developing and Implementing Intelligent Credit Scoring.

name: r-scorecard
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.8" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-scorecard
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/scorecard_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/scorecard/scorecard_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8876832701ff049d306e5186aceed14232a11e010a9a68310a272e8d34e9e1ec

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table >=1.10.0
    - r-doparallel
    - r-foreach
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-gridextra
    - r-openxlsx
    - r-stringi
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-data.table >=1.10.0
    - r-doparallel
    - r-foreach
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-gridextra
    - r-openxlsx
    - r-stringi

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('scorecard')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('scorecard')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ShichenXie/scorecard
  license: MIT
  summary: 'The `scorecard` package makes the development of credit risk scorecard easier and efficient by providing functions for some common tasks, such as data partition, variable selection, woe binning, scorecard scaling, performance evaluation and report generation. These functions can also used in the development of
    machine learning models. The references including: 1. Refaat, M. (2011, ISBN: 9781447511199). Credit Risk Scorecard: Development and Implementation Using SAS. 2. Siddiqi, N. (2006, ISBN: 9780471754510). Credit risk scorecards. Developing and Implementing Intelligent Credit Scoring.'
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - philip-khor

# Package: scorecard
# Version: 0.3.0
# Title: Credit Risk Scorecard
# Description: The `scorecard` package makes the development of credit risk scorecard easier and efficient by providing functions for some common tasks, such as data partition, variable selection, woe binning, scorecard scaling, performance evaluation and report generation. These functions can also used in the development of machine learning models. The references including: 1. Refaat, M. (2011, ISBN: 9781447511199). Credit Risk Scorecard: Development and Implementation Using SAS. 2. Siddiqi, N. (2006, ISBN: 9780471754510). Credit risk scorecards. Developing and Implementing Intelligent Credit Scoring.
# Authors@R: person("Shichen", "Xie", , "xie@shichen.name", c("aut", "cre"))
# Depends: R (>= 3.5.0)
# Imports: data.table (>= 1.10.0), ggplot2, gridExtra, foreach, doParallel, parallel, openxlsx, stringi
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown, pkgdown, testthat
